intro: Gagea pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf spring beauty, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its bulbs are fleshy and serve as storage organs for nutrients, aiding in its survival through harsh conditions. Gagea pusilla is often found in the eastern United States and parts of Canada.
